tp.pr5.instructions

Class Commands

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr5.instructions.Commands
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Instruction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BuyInstruction, DefuseInstruction, DropInstruction, HelpInstruction, MoveInstruction, OperateInstruction, PickInstruction, QuitInstruction, RadarInstruction, ScanInstruction, ShopInstruction, StormInstruction, TriggerInstruction, TurnInstruction, UndoInstruction

    public abstract class Commands
extends java.lang.Object
implements Instruction
    Abstract class for all the common instructions which executes WALLÂ·E. It implements the method configureContext of Instruction interface
    Author:
    Abel Serrano Juste

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Commands()
      There are constructor for testing purposes and others, but it's not natural way no create new commands.
      'Parse' is a factory method for creating new Instruction objects.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configureContext(RobotEngine engine, NavigationModule navigation, ItemContainer robotContainer)
      Set the execution context.
      void undo()
      Undo this instruction, returning to the state previous of the robot to perform this instruction.
      We assume that the instruction was correctly executed previously, so it shouldn't throw any exception.
      Override this if undo the inherited instruction implies any change in the robot.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • configureContext

        public void configureContext(RobotEngine engine,
                    NavigationModule navigation,
                    ItemContainer robotContainer)
        Set the execution context.
        Specified by:
        configureContext in interface Instruction
        Parameters:
        engine - The robot engine
        navigation - The information about the game, i.e., the places, current direction and current heading to navigate
        robotContainer - The inventory of the robot

      • undo

        public void undo()
          throws InstructionExecutionException
        Undo this instruction, returning to the state previous of the robot to perform this instruction.
        We assume that the instruction was correctly executed previously, so it shouldn't throw any exception.
        Override this if undo the inherited instruction implies any change in the robot.
        Specified by:
        undo in interface Instruction
        Throws:
        InstructionExecutionException - If the instruction can't be undone.
